definition: The subsequent approval by a party (or its legal successor) of a juridical act that was initially voidable or performed by a non-representative, thereby validating the act from its inception.
japaneseDefinition: 無権代理人の行為や取消し得る行為などについて、後からその行為を有効なものとして認める意思表示。
legalContext: Civil Code Art. 113: If a person who performs a juridical act on behalf of another person without representative authority (non-agent) does so, the act shall be effective only if ratified by the principal.
japaneseLegalContext: 民法第113条: 代理権を有しない者が他人の代理人としてした行為は、本人がこれを追認しなければ、その本人に対して効力を生じない。
exampleSentence: The principal may exercise the right of ratification against the third party concerning the contract performed without power of representation.
exampleTranslation: 本人は、無権代理人による契約について、第三者に対して追認の権利を行使できる。
